shared

Class CustomHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.Handler
      • shared.CustomHandler

  • public class CustomHandler
extends java.util.logging.Handler
    Output handler that selects the output stream based on the LogRecord received. Handler will select standard out if the level is below WARNING and will select standard error otherwise to print the message with the formatter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomHandler(java.io.OutputStream error, java.io.OutputStream stdout, java.util.logging.Formatter formatter) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes both of the output writers given they are initialized.
      void flush()
      Flushes both the standard output and error output writers given they are initialized.
      boolean isLoggable(java.util.logging.LogRecord record)
      Checks if the record given is loggable by checking the streams can write the record.
      void publish(java.util.logging.LogRecord record)
      Publish the LogRecord using the error stream writer if the level is WARNING or above and otherwise write using the standard out writer.

      • isLoggable

        public boolean isLoggable(java.util.logging.LogRecord record)
        Checks if the record given is loggable by checking the streams can write the record.
        Overrides:
        isLoggable in class java.util.logging.Handler
        Parameters:
        record - LogRecord to write using one of the writers
        Returns:
        True if the record is loggable, false otherwise

      • publish

        public void publish(java.util.logging.LogRecord record)
        Publish the LogRecord using the error stream writer if the level is WARNING or above and otherwise write using the standard out writer. Flushes the output on both writers after it is written.
        Specified by:
        publish in class java.util.logging.Handler
        Parameters:
        record - LogRecord to write using one of the writers

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes both the standard output and error output writers given they are initialized.
        Specified by:
